1956

Imperial mediat ca a

aqt may 1912, ñ

fait u Cria, 
Alfred & Alarmes Esquire,

Dear Sir, 
26 with a later dated 1

I have asked your 
Haird assistance to facilitate my You S.S. 
Kwan to return home for a visit mundiate 
ofter his examination, and spend he's 
Summer holiday at home in China. 
y trust therefore that you will provide

i url tu necessary expeudelures from 
The fund , remittedl sore weeks ágos 
to Erich huis to take Cue shortest and 
Cheapest route in Pis return. En

s vern auxious to see him and 
y her destra will not be accomplished 
dam afraid, then shall be a grave 
consequee because she has been 
recover from serious pictuen. Phase 
Courne

me the loudilo 
and oblige Chit Gest wishes from

Gorss luat Pencerch

Jeg

Kwan

En s vern auxious to see him and y her destra will not be accomplished dam afraid, then shall be a grave consequee because she has been recover from serious pictuen. Phase Courne me the loudilo and oblige Chit Gest wishes from Gorss luat Pencerch Jeg Kwan

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter requesting permission for his son to return to China for the summer, using existing funds, and the shortest and cheapest route for the trip. He states that his wife is eager to see their son, having recovered from a serious illness.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
